qas.question: What does successful migration depend on for some waders?

answers.text: the availability of certain key food resources
stopover points along the migration route

qas.question: Where is an important stopover location?

context: For some species of waders, migration success depends on <a0_0>the availability of certain key food resources<a0_0/> at <a1_0>stopover points along the migration route<a1_0/>. This gives the migrants an opportunity to refuel for the next leg of the voyage. Some examples of important stopover locations are <a2_0>the Bay of Fundy<a2_0/> and <a3_0>Delaware Bay<a3_0/>.
